thread.title: 3rd ODI: Unchanged South Africa bat in Rajkot; India pick Amit Mishra
thread.title_full: 3rd ODI: Unchanged South Africa bat in Rajkot; India pick Amit Mishra

title: 3rd ODI: Unchanged South Africa bat in Rajkot; India pick Amit Mishra
text:
The 5-match series is level at 1-1. South Africa won the opener in Kanpur by 5 runs while India bounced back in the 2nd with a 22-run success in Indore. AB de Villiers won the toss 
South Africa are unchanged while India brought in leg-spinner Amit Mishra in place of paceman Umesh Yadav. The hosts have a three-man spin attack in Harbhajan Singh, Axar Patel and Mishra. 
"This is a terrific pitch for batting," said former India skipper Sunil Gavaskar in his pitch report. De Villiers too agreed after winning the toss. India captain MS Dhoni said he too would have wanted to bat first. 
Playing XIs 
India: Shikhar Dhawan, Rohit Sharma, Ajinkya Rahane, Virat Kohli, Mahendra Singh Dhoni (captain and wicketkeeper), Suresh Raina, Axar Patel, Harbhajan Singh, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Amit Mishra, Mohit Sharma. 
South Africa: Quinton de Kock (wicketkeeper), David Miller, AB De Villiers (captain), Hashim Amla, Faf du Plessis, JP Duminy, Farhaan Behardien, Dale Steyn, Imran Tahir, Kagiso Rabada, Morne Morkel. 
4th ODI in Chennai on October 22 (Thursday) 
OneIndia News
